data.title: Magnificent!!
data.text:
What an amazing statue ....King Kamehameha is magnificent!
In the centre of Honolulu ...opposite the Palace...its rightful place!!
Wonderful tribute!

data.title: Landmarks of Honolulu
data.text: You should not miss the statue of the King when visiting historic parts of Honolulu.  The history of this city is so enticing and so easy to get around and see.

data.title: Ever watch Hawaii 5'o....
data.text: I watched the original series and the new series this was a place that both my wife and I had to see. We came at night it is well lit and we got some good pics. Several people drove up with the same idea to get e pic. Iconic place due to the tv show.

data.title: Leader of the Hawaiian Islands
data.text: A reminder of how the Hawaiian Islands came under one king and united together.  The location across from the palace of the last rulers of the Hawaii Kingdom before becoming a part of the United States.

data.title: The palace is a must see when visiting the Island
data.text: This is a great site to visit, to walk around and to take a tour inside.  Beautiful statue and part of the history of Hawaii

data.title: A must-see attraction
data.text:
This is an iconic statue that symbolises the unification of Hawaii.

It is outside Aliiolani Hale, home to the Hawaii State Supreme Court, and opposite the Iolani Palace in downtown Honolulu.

data.title: Definitely a must see for us
data.text: Had to stop to see the statue of the only king in US history. As others have already stated, its across the road from the lolani palace. The bonus was the Hawaii Five-O building in the background.

data.title: along with the palace in the back ground
data.text: this is a must do if you visit Honolulu Hawaii. so much culture here you learn about the king and how he brought all the islands together.

data.title: Hey, it's a statue.
data.text: What can one say? It is a statue. There is nothing special about it unless you watched the original HAWAII 5-0 series on television. The statue and some of the surroundings were featured on said television program.

data.title: Beautiful Statue in front of an amazing old government building
data.text: We only saw this statue from our bus window, but all of the buildings around were very interesting.  I would have loved to explore them and seen the statue up close.

data.title: Good to see
data.text: This was interesting and a good place to stop that is a famous part of Hawaii and Waikiki. A must see and must get a pic in front of.

data.title: A '50' must do
data.text: As travellers from the UK and am sure not the only ones following the Hawaii '50' aspects of the Island we got the local bus from Waikiki to seek out the Statue and take the usual photos. However the building behind is a great place to visit and just spend 30 mins getting lots of background history of the evolution of the Island and Law of the Island. It's free (make a donation) and peaceful as a working building but worth seeking out if you want to just understand the historic origins of the island.

data.title: a must see
data.text:
Beautiful piece of history.
The statue is beautiful.   This is one item that we can cross off of our bucket list, although we will likely revisit on our next trip to Hawaii.

data.title: Symbol of historical Hawaii you must see
data.text: He is perhaps the most important historical figure in Hawaii.  Was King 1756-1819.  It's a towering and suitably majestic statue which is a must see in downtown Honolulu. Easiest to get to by the Red Line Trolley

data.title: ICONIC STATUE ACROSS FROM IOLANI PALACE
data.text: Majestic statue of King Kamehameha I, in front of Ali'iolani Hale (home to the Hawaii State Supreme Court), faces Iolani palace. Must see on June 11, King Kamehameha day. Great photo opportunity. Make this a must visit on your stay on O'ahu.

data.title: Just a statue... BUT....
data.text: This is a just a statue and if we didn't see it I would not have lost any sleep... BUT what was so interesting to me was the history of the Island of Hawaii.  Very sad for the local people.  So happy that along with just this statue came some amazing history.  Make sure you do your research if you're not on a tour.

data.title: King Kamehameha
data.text: All I can say is that if you haven't visited the King Kamehameha Statue site,  you really haven't visited Hawaii. Great for taking close up pics with the King of Hawaii. Also shown in many exterior established shot scenes of Hawaii 5-0.

data.title: Just like on Hawaii five O
data.text: Brings TV series Hawaii Five O closer to home seeing this statue. Truly a special place to visit. this was a stop on out island tour well worth the time. The entire place is just beautiful, clean and a must see on your island visit.

data.title: Stately
data.text:
Yes we saw the statue when visiting the Queen Ioloni castle.
It's very pricey for what you get to see, but- it's a delightful tour...just too much money

data.title: A must see
data.text: Interesting history and a must see while in Oahu especially for Hawaii Five-0 fans. Lots to see in the area.
